body.p: This index of Akkadian roots refers to the principal lemma(ta) in the Concise Dictionary of Akkadian which are verbs in which the root letters may occur. It does not refer to other parts of speech (to which reference is made at the end of each verb). The aleph sign (ʾ) refers to ALL weaknesses, including medial ā, ī, and ū, except for initial w.
ʾ | B | D | G | Ḫ | K | L | M | N | P | Q | R | S | Ṣ | Š | T | Ṭ | W | Z

tr.td: abālu(m) I; apālu(m) I; ebēlu; wabālu(m)
arû IV.V.VIII; erû(m) V; warûm II; wurrûm
baʾālu(m); bâlu I; bêlu(m); bullu I
barû(m) I.IV.V; berû(m) II; bitrû II
arāru(m) III; ḫarāru(m) I; šuḫarruru(m) II; šuḫruru
mašāʾu(m) I; mašû(m) II; muššuʾu; šumšû(m); wussûm
nabāʾu(m) I; nabû(m) II; nebû(m) II
parāʾu(m) I.II; parû III.IV; purrûm II
salāḫu(m) II; salāʾu(m) I.II.III; sullû(m) IV; šalû(m) I.II
ṣabāʾum; ṣabû(m) IV; ṣapû(m) II; ṣubbû(m)
šâʾu(m); šaʾû(m) II; šêʾu(m) I.II; šeʾû(m); šuḫḫû III; šutaʾʾûm
šaʾāru(m) I.II; šâru II; šeʾēru II; šêru(m); šurru(m)
šawû II; šemû(m) I; šummû II
šarû(m) II; šerû I.II.III; šurrû(m) II
